alert.note: Alert for Frederick; Washington (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 07 at 1:32PM EDT until September 07 at 3:30PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR SOUTHWESTERN FREDERICK AND SOUTHEASTERN WASHINGTON COUNTIES IN NORTH CENTRAL MARYLAND... At 132 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicate thunderstorms have produced heavy rain of 1 to 2.5 inches across the warned area. 1 to 2 inches of additional rain is expected between 1:30 and 2:30 PM. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Robinwood... Brunswick... Boonsboro... Mount Aetna... Mount Lena... San Mar... Saint James... Jefferson... Myersville... Keedysville... Sharpsburg... Fairplay... Rosemont... Rohrersville... Burkittsville... Gapland... Brownsville... Antietam... Bolivar... Arnoldtown... This includes the following Flood Prone Roads: Shank Road near Catoctin Creek... Station Road near Catoctin Creek... Bennies Hill Road near Cone Branch... Sigler Road near Catoctin Creek Tributary... Brockton Court at Brockton Drive... FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1-2 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
